allow: Bash(# Check the simulator''s screen properties xcrun simctl io 524C60A5-B207-40F8-9627-9C4F60498C8D screenshot /tmp/home.png # Also check device type info xcrun simctl list devicetypes)
Bash(# Check what resolution the iPhone 17 Pro actually has xcrun simctl list devicetypes)
Bash(# Check Xcode 26 iOS app templates for any new Info.plist keys find /Applications/Xcode-26.2.0.app -name ""*.stencil"" -path ""*iOS*"")

Bash(# Look at the iOS App Base template to see what keys are generated cat ""/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Library/Xcode/Templates/Project Templates/MultiPlatform/Application/iOS App Base.xctemplate/TemplateInfo.plist"")

Bash(# Check if there are iOS 26-specific SDK headers for new windowing APIs find /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs -name ""UIWindowScene.h"")
Bash(head -80 else echo "Settings.app not at expected path" find ~/Library/Developer/CoreSimulator/Devices/524C60A5*/data/Containers/Bundle/Application -maxdepth 2 -name "*.app")

Bash(# Look at the iOS 26 Info.plist keys documentation find ""/Applications/Xcode.app"" -name ""*.xcspec"" | xargs grep -l ""UIRequiresFullScreen\\|UIApplicationSceneManifest\\|UIWindowingBehavior\\|UISupportsFullScreen"")
Bash(# Find where system apps are stored in the simulator runtime find /Library/Developer/CoreSimulator/Volumes -name ""Settings.app"" -maxdepth 8)
Bash(# Find system apps in CoreSimulator runtime volumes ls /Library/Developer/CoreSimulator/Volumes/)

Bash(# Temporarily add UIApplicationSceneManifest_Generation=YES to see what it generates # First check what keys come from the Multiplatform SwiftUI App template cat ""/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Library/Xcode/Templates/Project Templates/MultiPlatform/Base/Multiplatform SwiftUI App.xctemplate/TemplateInfo.plist"" | plutil -p -)
